a.span: Go to School Board Member Access...

h1.font:
Dear Students, Staff, and Community Members,
Today the governor has announced that all Illinois schools will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. The Pawnee Schools will continue to utilize remote learning days for all of the students until May 28th. The senior class last day for remote learning will be May 15th. Students are still expected to complete daily assignments from their teachers until the end of the school year. A decision for a time and date for graduation will be released when all information is finalized.
Yours in Education,
Scott Cameron
Superintendent
Pawnee Schools

hr.font: Any current 8th grade to 11th grade girl interested in Volleyball for next year to please join the edmodo page 2020 Volleyball with code r4wnic

h1.font: Reminder to all Student Council seniors, the Student Council Scholarship is due by May 1st.

hr.h1: All current and interested students, 8th grade to seniors, who are interested in being a Student Council member for next year please join the edmodo page 2020-2021 Student Council with code 4i4yu3. Updates will be posted for you on the page.

div.p:
In order to place meal requests during an emergency closure, please complete this form for each child in your home who is attending Pawnee CUSD #11. There is no charge for these meals. Please click on the link below to take the survey.
Survey

a.aria-label: Read more about Food Service Survey

div.p:
STUDENT MATERIALS PICK UP TIMES
We will have pick up of Pawnee CUSD #11 student materials next Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday April 29-May 1, from 9-12 each day.
We will stage all grade school materials in the PE gym at the north end of the building. Parents are to drive around the north end of the building to the back of the school by the grade school playground. You will . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Student Material Pick-up Info

div.p:
April 20, 2020
Dear Class of 2020,
Words cannot describe the amount of loss that you have felt as a class this year. I am truly sorry this is how things have played out but as we know, the situation is out of our hands. In the big picture of things, what is important is that all of you and your families are safe and healthy. With that being said, we are still going to . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Letter to Graduates

div.p:
Pawnee CUSD #11 Educational Goals:
We will assume flexibility and grace for all. We will model resilience, empathy, and thoughtful responsiveness. We will provide opportunities for continued learning that focuses on essential standards. We will emphasize interaction, authentic and differentiated learning opportunities. We will focus on learning content, not on learning . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Pawnee CUSD #11 Remote Learning Plan

div.p:
The Pawnee FFA will be selling flowers and vegetables. Please contact Mr. Rawlings at mrawlings@pawneeschools.org to place an order and schedule a pickup time.

div.p:
Dear Parents and Community Members,
If you have not done so already, we would like to encourage you to complete your 2020 Census online at www.my2020census.gov or by phone at 1-844-330-2020.
You must have your Census ID , which was mailed to each household by the U.S. Census Bureau. If you prefer to complete a paper Census, they . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about 2020 Census

div.p:
Chromebook Guidelines for Students and Parents
This document provides detailed information to parents and students about how to care for the technology being entrusted to them.
1. Receiving a Chromebook
a. Student Signature
Students will sign a form accepting a Chromebook, and by signing, agree to the terms of use at Pawnee CUSD #11. Chromebooks will be allowed to . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Chromebook Guidelines for Students

div.p:
AT&T
AT&T is expanding “Access from AT&T,” our low-cost home internet offering to qualifying households AT&T will continue to offer internet access for qualifying limited income households at $10 a month through our Access from AT&T program. They’ve expanded eligibility to Access from AT&T to households participating in the . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Internet Options

div.p:
Counseling Resources for Students and Parents. Please reach out to our school counselor Julie Meyer ( jmeyer@pawneeschools.org ) with any questions.

div.em: Current conditions as of 29 Apr 06:35 am CDT

div.span: Showers, mainly after 1pm. High near 54. West wind 13 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.

Showers, mainly before 1am. Low around 44. Northwest wind around 17 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New precipitation amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.
Mostly sunny, with a high near 62. Breezy, with a northwest wind 17 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 32 mph.
